page.title: 12Caldewell House. 1.
page.content: Caldewell House is a half Georgian, half Victorian house. Much of this area used to belong to the Caldewell Estate. The land was divided by Ha Ha's, now fences have been put there. The owners of Caldewell have included a mini railway in the gardens. This railway divides a tiny wood from a path called Lovers Walk. Years ago lovers used to walk down the path which made a pear shape, now the path is overgrown. There is a pond-come-lake in the grounds. It used to be used for topping up a brook which ran down to{Caldewell Mill.}Now the pond is used for boating and fishing. Herons and Canada geese have been seen on the pond. Pike, roach, eels and trout have been caught in the pond by fishermen and guests who stay at the house. A donkey, cow, two goats, chickens, bees and ducks all
